author: daniel castillo
comment: Update : stopped using face due to lack of ambient cards. Waiting for an update.... Awesome concept,  can't wait for future releases...  One question,  my notifications don't stay visible on the watch after it dims...  Is that something with the watch face?  My stock faces didn't act this way. Also agree,  need ability to increase font size and battery meter icons. Thanx

reply.author: John Vidler
reply.content: Hi Daniel! The notifications not showing in ambient mode is part of the face - they should pop right back when you look at the watch. I'll be adding a toggle for that behaviour in the next release though (with font sizes too), if you prefer to keep them on screen. I did it that way mainly to try and avoid burn-in potential problems on OLED screens.

title: New daily driver

author: Jim Stewart
comment: Love being able to see the different calendar options.  5th star if you offer the option to specify different text size.  For my old eyes,  I'd consider the numbers on the time 'Medium' but the Day of week, day of month etc 'Small'.  The current events view should mostly likely have similar text size options.  Would appreciate a Small, Medium, Large, Maybe Extra large option for text sizes.  .   If given a preference I'd most likely not show the 'Arc' branding.  My watch is the LG G Watch.

reply.author: John Vidler
reply.content: Hi Jim, thanks for the comments! Additional font and style options are in the works, and will be coming with the next update - watch this space!

author: Johnny Molina
comment: This app is extremely useful! As someone going through Android wear udacity course to try and implement something similar, I am super pleased to see that's it's been made already! Won't stop me from trying to figure out how you made it possible though!
title: Awesome app!

author: Gabriel Grant
comment: Thank you. This is an obvious win. Now please make it amazing... I'd like to get rid of the shadow/3d effects, Id like the battery guages to go into a black and white mode or be subtle all of the time, Id like to remive the word "arc" as it just clutters the screen, obviously Id like to be able to atleast change colors or even watch face styles entirely while still seeing the calendar arcs. I would actually like this as an overlay onto other wear watch faces. Regardless, thank you.
title: Most functional android wear app yet

author: Rade Lukic
comment: I'm pleased I got this app way back. But I find myself looking for alternatives and I don't know that I'd buy it right now. Wear 2.0 complications would be a nice upgrade for which I would pay. If there were an arc to represent precipitation probability, or the Accuweather MinuteCast, that would be magnificent.  If we're throwing in more arcs, may as well include arcs for fitness tracking.

author: Tony Loo
comment: Great to integrate calendar in the interface! However on dark mode the event has shadow effect that causes the words unreadable, thus defeats the purpose. Please fix this as a priority over all other issues! Really important! Picture in play store shows diff color backing for diff events, don't see that option. Will be helpful if there is this function!
title: Dark mode Issue

author: slava kosoy
comment: Not worth it anymore. Feels like the app is no longer supported. Sync issues, calendar setting issues, app state issues. I can describe in details if anyone asks. I paid for this face - it worked magic before.

author: Anna Jochum
comment: The older version didn't work for me but the update seems to have solved the problem. If you are crazy busy and rely on Google Calendar to keep your days in order, this is the watch face for you.

reply.author: John Vidler
reply.content: Thanks Anna! Glad to hear the new build is working for you.

title: Great for busy moms

author: Ryan Semonich
comment: Had been eyeing this for a while not sure if I'd actually dig it. Gotta say its super clean and nice looking. Customization options are great, as is the list of what's to come. Great watch face!
title: Really love this

author: michael sayre
comment: A previous version of this was great. Now, because I have a long list of calendars, I'm unable to select mine. Scrolling down the list shows my calendar, but when I select it and leave the settings, then come back, only the top boxes have been selected. It's as though the scrolling never happened. I can't use this face as a result.
title: Can't select my calendar

author: James R. Newman
comment: 5 stars for appearance, 2 stars for calendar integration methodology  Very attractive watch-face.  Unfortunately, the calendar integration itself is a little clunky.  My main grump - I added an "Exchange" account type to track work emails and appointments.  This works for the Albumen watch face (which apparently uses the native Google Wear integration).  However, this watch face is unaware of it, and due to its UI, I suspect that it accesses the calendars directly using a different API.

author: Stephen Cornwell
comment: My new favourite watch face. The location of the numbers could do with a tweak on the Huawei Watch, they all seem to be offset slightly too low leaving an uneven gap between the 12 and the top marker and the 6 and the bottom marker. The tick options are especially nice.

reply.author: John Vidler
reply.content: I must admit, the hour numbers were a bit of an 11th-hour addition! I'll be tweaking them in the next release.

author: Douglas Kilpatrick
comment: Best face I've found so far for "hey, look.  Your schedule".  The ability to select WHICH calendars to show is crucial for me.  Could use more customization options like "highlight color" (yellow doesn't do it for me).  The agenda view is basically illegible for me due to bad sharpening/interpolation.  I'd like more options for the complications, like "signal strength" or "exercise" or what have you. I'd like a better "low battery mode" for my watch-with-no-battery.  But it does what it says, and works well for that purpose.  Thanks.

author: Oleh Vasyliv
comment: UPDATE: It is impossible to select calendars if there is a scroll bar and you scroll down to calendars at the bottom.  /////// I really like the idea with displaying calendar events around the clock.

reply.author: John Vidler
reply.content: Thanks for the review! I'm working on getting a better way to display the events for longer durations! Stay tuned :)

title: Great watch face

author: Scott Konop
comment: Great looking face but my appointments don't show up on my LG G watch.  User error?
title: Can't get it to work

author: Peter Elliot
comment: Suggestions: Option for thicker hands, Bigger day number when month and year hidden, Option for abbreviated month and day text, Hide ARC, Option for step count. Keep up the good work!
title: Excellent, Useful, Watchface

author: Alexander Clifton-Melhuish
comment: A great start - the first watch I've found that really takes advantage of a smart watch. I'm looking forward to seeing more styles. My only requests would be to somehow make am and pm appointments distinct. Maybe events more than 11 hours away could be 50% opacity? And I don't like the events list - why not just load the Agenda app instead?

author: Mark Reisch
comment: Great response from developer. Newest update is fantastic. Can't wait to see upcoming designs! Also the new daily agenda feature is really easy and helpful!

reply.author: John Vidler
reply.content: Thanks Mark! Glad to hear the new build is working for you

title: Great design and features

author: Wynand Gouws
comment: To me this is the app that makes a smart watch worth having. Would love features to keep coming (eg. don't show all day events etc) but I still love it

author: Tony McAndrew
comment: Great app for spotting when I should be somewhere. I'd like the ability to change calendar colours in the app, and an option to show appointments marked "free" rather than see them in same as background colour. Also, the list view on tap could be massively improved. Please increase the font size on that list and make it scrollable. Looking forward to the next update.
title: Nice watch face

author: Kevin Barksdale
comment: Like this app. Doesn't consume much battery and the standby mode still looks good. Just needs to increase font size  for the day/date.
title: Clean Interface

author: James Kraus
comment: Most of the elements of the watchface are too small to read in sunlight (or without my glasses in any light). Can the developer scale up the watchface text/hands? Using a huawei watch, for reference. Edit: Simple text filtering of calendar events would be nice. Regex filtering would be nuts.

reply.author: John Vidler
reply.content: More customisation options are in the works for the next update, including text and hand sizes. Watch this space! :) Edit: Regex matching on text and metadata, added to feature request list (and yes, it would be nuts!)

title: Pretty good

author: Brian Pundyke
comment: I love it. Even though it needs more work,  this is what I use every day. Definitely worth the money and more.  Haven't found anything to equal or better it.  Looking forward to font and font size selection and Google fit integration. Keep up the good work!
title: Elegant design

author: Ashley Laumbach
comment: Just waiting on the color options. I hate orange lol but also do we have an expected date for the upcoming update?? This is the only calendar watch face I like, but I'd like more options. Thanks in advance!   Also, wish it showed all day events as well like birthdays but I can't seem to get those to show?

author: Markus Klein
comment: Like the look over all. Would be nice if I could remove the drop shadow and also increase the size of the font for the date and day. Would get 5 stars then.

author: Natan Dieza
comment: Not working on Samsung Gear Live, the calendar won't show up! Thank you.
title: Please Help

author: Thomas Malenich
comment: Love this but when you tap on the color it takes you to a screen which only uses about 1/10th of the available space on an already small device! I'll keep it in hopes the update comes soon.....
title: 5 stars when font update comes

author: Blake Praharaj
comment: Wonderful app, my only suggestion would be to allow for weather and step radials, as those are always useful, the api shouldn't be too rough to pull over, a lot of bang for your buck!

reply.author: John Vidler
reply.content: Thanks Blake! Google Fit integration is in the works, and I've been searching for a good weather API provider that doesn't cost the Earth to work with - hopefully looking to get that integrated soon too.

title: Good app

author: Donmichael Bockhoff
comment: Doesn't work on Android Wear 2.0 and last updated 8/2015. This app is dead.

author: Matthew Macdonald
comment: A great watchface that lets me see what the day ahead brings. Emailed the developer prior to purchase and he was extremely helpful.  Looking forward to the updates that are in the pipeline.
title: Does exactly what it says

author: Pete Reitano
comment: It drains my battery more than other watch faces. Love the design and elegance.

reply.author: John Vidler
reply.content: I try to keep a balance between battery drain and keeping the calendar up-to-date (a difficult thing when I can't do push updates as the Google API is super lazy in telling me things have changed!) but I'm surprised it was significantly more draining - can you email me with the details of your watch? Thanks!

title: Very Nice But...

author: Lubos Kuzma
comment: It's everything I needed. It's stylish and has a visual representation of my appointments. This was the first and so far my only Wear purchase. My daily driver. Thank you.
title: Love this watch

author: Jed Dye
comment: Useless for me! Can't select all the calendars I need! Can't add more than 10!! wtf?

reply.author: John Vidler
reply.content: Please contact me by email regarding this issue - you should be able to select any number of calendars!

author: David Jaffa
comment: Bug in that the Calendars selected are not saved (I have a lot of calendars) therefore no events display on the watch. I.e. the selection of calendars is not persistent.

author: John
comment: Needs bigger font option and remove Arc logo since I paid for this. LOVE how the dim screen face is same as screen on face... Almost. Please don't change that.

reply.author: John Vidler
reply.content: Fonts and more options are going to be in the next release - watch this space! My whole idea behind this design was speed-of-information based; keeping as much information as possible visible for the ambient mode is of primary concern - it's not going to change any time soon!

title: Looks nice on huawei

author: Russian Bot
comment: Love the calendar integration. Can't wait to see it developed further (font, size, color options).
title: Very useful!

author: Ayatollah Andre Prabowo
comment: Really great watchface! I would give another star if it sync with my caldav :) great job pal!
title: Caldav support?

author: Dave Callaghan
comment: This is the watch app I was looking for; it provides tons of information quickly and efficiently with an outstanding UI.  Kudos to the developer.
title: Wow

author: Gareth Hill
comment: Looks fantastic, I would like the option to remove the Arc from the screen centre though.
title: Great watch face

author: Andrew Risbey
comment: Like this app. Works well on my Sony smartwatch 3, with my S6 edge running Android wear.
